thread.title: Democrats Sit as Trump Enters House Chamber, Begins Address to Congress
thread.title_full: Democrats Sit as Trump Enters House Chamber, Begins Address to Congress

author: Chandler Gill
title: Democrats Sit as Trump Enters House Chamber, Begins Address to Congress
text:
Congressional Democrats either stayed seated or sat down quickly as President Donald Trump entered the House chamber to give his first address to a joint session of Congress on Tuesday evening.
Many Democrats could be spotted in their seats as others stood and applauded before Trump was set to speak, including Republican members of Congress.
It is customary for the audience to remain standing as a sign of respect to the president before the formal speech begins.
However, at least eighteen members of Congress could be seen seated.
This speech comes hours after some saying that they were going to protest this joint address.
Rep. Maxine Waters (D., Calif.) said earlier Tuesday that she was not going to attend the speech at all. She said that this is a form of boycotting the president.
She is the only congresswoman to be skipping the speech all together as of Tuesday morning, The Hill reported .
The post Democrats Sit as Trump Enters House Chamber, Begins Address to Congress appeared first on Washington Free Beacon .
